HelpXML.Title: HYPeff
HelpXML.Purpose: HYPeff finds constant c which is associated to the requested efficiency for hyperbolic estimator

Item.Name: eff
Item.LongDesc: Scalar which contains the required efficiency (of location or scale estimator). Generally eff=0.85, 0.9 or 0.95

Item.Name: v
Item.LongDesc: Number of variables of the dataset (for regression v=1) UP TO NOW v=1 (JUST REGRESSION) TO DO FOR MULTIVARIATE ANALYSIS

Item.Name: k
Item.ShortDesc: supremum of the change of variance curve
Item.LongDesc: $\sup CVC(psi,x) x \in R$ Default value is k=4.5.

Item.Name: traceiter
Item.LongDesc: If traceiter = 1 it is possible to monitor how the value of the objective function B^2/A gets closer to the target (eff) during the iterations

Item.Name: c
Item.TypeInd: parameter c of hyperbolic tangent estimator.
Item.LongDesc: For more details see the methodological details inside "More About" below

Item.Name: A
Item.TypeInd: parameter A of hyperbolic tangent estimator.
Item.LongDesc: For more details see the methodological details inside "More About" below

Item.Name: B
Item.TypeInd: parameter B of hyperbolic tangent estimator.
Item.LongDesc: For more details see the methodological details inside "More About" below

Item.Name: d
Item.TypeInd: parameter d of hyperbolic tangent estimator.
Item.LongDesc: For more details see the methodological details inside "More About" below

HelpXML.MoreAbout: \[ HYPpsi(u) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} u & |u| \leq d \\ \sqrt{A (k - 1)} \tanh \left( \sqrt{(k - 1) B^2/A} (c -|u|)/2 \right) sign(u) & d \leq |u| < c, \\ 0 & |u| \geq c. \end{array} \right. \] It is necessary to have $0 < A < B < 2 normcdf(c)-1- 2 c \times normpdf(c) <1$

References.Item: Hampel,F.R., Rousseeuw P.J. and Ronchetti E.(1981), The Change-of-Variance Curve and Optimal Redescending M-Estimators, Journal of the American Statistical Association , Vol. 76, No. 375, pp. 643-648 (HRR)

Item.Title:
Find value of c, A, B, for a nominal efficiency of 0.8427 when k=4.5
ktuning=4.5; [c,A,B,d]=HYPeff(0.8427,1,ktuning); In this case c = 3.000130564905703 A = 0.604298601602487 B = 0.713612241773758 d= 1.304379168746527 See also Table 2 of HRR p.
Item.MATLABcode:
% Find value of c, A, B, for a nominal efficiency of 0.8427 % when k=4.5
ktuning=4.5; [c,A,B,d]=HYPeff(0.8427,1,ktuning); % In this case % c = 3.000130564905703 % A = 0.604298601602487 % B = 0.713612241773758 % d= 1.304379168746527 % See also Table 2 of HRR p. 645
